column4: is it even possible to dual bnoot? I got 7 gigs left on the system drive
Ubuntu is about 1.8Gb installed, so you should have space w/ 7Gb
I'd do a 2.5 or 3Gb root, and the rest of that 7Gb as /home partition...
I will go to wikipedia to see what that means :)
heh... sorry, I assumed you spoke Linux... ;)
do you know what a harddrive partition is?
OK... Windows generally uses one big partition; the OS and your own files all together. Linux generally uses two partitions, one for the OS and /home for the user
you can use everything in one partition if you want
yes there is - the Ubuntu installer can do it, among other methods
NTFS is read only for Linux
what do you do that needs whole drives moved around like that?
ok aso this is what I want to grab right? http://www.ubuntu.com/download/
that's where you'll get the ISOs of Ubuntu, yes
if you're running Ubuntu, you have a BT client built in..
WinRAR has some odd ideas about what it should open - it screws with Java jar files too
see the wiki URL I gave you earlier, it's got info on verifying md5 in XP
